billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Provides for a deduction from personal income for adoption expenses
summary: Provides for a deduction against personal gross income in an amount equal to fees, costs and expenses paid or incurred including legal fees and agency costs in connection with the adoption of a child.
memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2761

TITLE OF BILL:
An act to amend the tax law, in relation to providing for a deduction
from personal gross income for expenses incurred in the adoption of a
child

PURPOSE:
To allow those who adopt a child to deduct
from their gross income tax purposes any and all costs incurred in legal
fees, agency costs, etc. in the adoption proceedings.

JUSTIFICATION:
Expenses incurred for adoption
services should not be taxable. This bill would delete those actual
expenses from gross income.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
A.567 of 1992
A.3864 of 1993-1994
S.2729 of 2001-2002
S.3853 of 2003-2004
S.2240 of 2005-2006
S.2851/A.5361 of 2007-2008
2009-10:  S.5256/A.6060 (Errigo) - Referred to Senate Investigations
and Government Operations/Assembly Ways & Means

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
To be determined.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect
immediately and shall apply to all taxable years beginning on or after
the first day of January in the year in which it shall have become law.
